title: فَاء السَّبَبِيَّة
description: Learn about فاء السببية, the causative fa particle that causes the verb after it to take the subjunctive mood (منصوب), and the conditions required for its usage.

notes.title: What is فاء السببية?
content: فاء السببية is a causative fa particle that indicates the result or consequence of what precedes it. When certain conditions are met, it causes the imperfect verb (المضارع) that follows it to be in the subjunctive mood (منصوب).
The verb after فاء السببية takes a hidden أَنْ before it, making it منصوب. For example: لَا تَكْسَلْ فَتَنْدَمَ (Do not be lazy, so you do not regret).
keyPoints: فاء السببية indicates cause and effect relationship
It causes the following verb to be منصوب (subjunctive)
There is an implied أَنْ between the فاء and the verb
The verb ending changes: يَفْعَلُ becomes يَفْعَلَ

examples.english: Do not be lazy, so you will not regret
Study so that you may succeed
He would not lie and thus lose
I wish I had wealth so I could spend

notes.title: Conditions for فاء السببية
content: فاء السببية does not cause نصب by itself. It must be preceded by one of several specific sentence types. Without these conditions, the فاء is just a regular conjunction (عاطفة).
The verb after it must be in the imperfect tense (المضارع) for the subjunctive effect to apply.
keyPoints: Must be preceded by: negation (نَفْي), command (أَمْر), prohibition (نَهْي), wish (تَمَنٍّ), hope (رَجَاء), or question (استفهام)
The فاء connects the cause with its effect/result
Without these conditions, the فاء is عاطفة (conjunctive) not سببية
The following verb must be مضارع (imperfect)

examples.english: Do not eat too much, lest you become sick (after prohibition)
Will you visit me so I may honor you? (after question)
Perhaps I will strive so that I may win (after hope)
I wish you would come so we could talk (after wish)

notes.title: فاء السببية after Negation and Command
content: When preceded by negation (using مَا، لَا، لَمْ، لَنْ, etc.), فاء السببية indicates the result that would occur without the negated action. When preceded by a command (أَمْر), it shows the positive outcome of obeying.
In the Quran: وَلَا تَطْغَوْا فِيهِ فَيَحِلَّ عَلَيْكُمْ غَضَبِي (And do not transgress therein, lest My anger descend upon you) - Taha 20:81.
keyPoints: After negation: shows what would result from the negated action
After command: shows the benefit of obeying
Quranic usage is common and classical
The subjunctive verb expresses purpose or result

examples.english: You do not come to us, so you do not speak with us
He did not strive so as to succeed
Sit down so that you may rest
Read so that you may learn

notes.title: فاء السببية after Wish, Hope, and Question
notes.titleArabic: فاء السببية بعد التمني والرجاء والاستفهام
content: Particles of wish (لَيْتَ) and hope (لَعَلَّ) create non-factual contexts where فاء السببية expresses the desired outcome. Questions (استفهام) followed by فاء السببية express the purpose or result of the questioned action.
These contexts are called غير موجبة (non-affirmative) because they do not assert a definite fact.
keyPoints: لَيْتَ (wish): لَيْتَنِي أَعْلَمُ فَأَعْمَلَ (I wish I knew so I could act)
لَعَلَّ (hope): لَعَلَّهُ يَتُوبُ فَيُغْفَرَ لَهُ (Perhaps he repents so he is forgiven)
Interrogatives: أَيْنَ، هَلْ، أَ، etc. can precede it
All create contexts of uncertainty or non-assertion

examples.english: I wish I had wealth so I could perform Hajj
Perhaps you will strive so that you may succeed
Where is your house so I may visit you?
Will you go with us so we may enjoy your company?

exercises.promptEn: Do not be lazy so that you do not _____ (regret)

Perhaps I will strive so that I may _____ (win)
